column3: The defaults were resulting in >1200 MB peak w/ mempool sharing. Might want to specifically name "such as systems with 1GB or less memory", and suggest the saving memory doc for more information.

>  and suggest the saving memory doc for more information\n\nYes linking to [reducing-bitcoind-memory-usage.md](https://gist.github.com/laanwj/efe29c7661ce9b6620a7) may make sense, it's still useful for <1GB memory, although it's out of date again with regard to dbcache defaults.
@laanwj Perhaps we should just incorporate that gist into the `doc/` directory, and then others can share in the burden of keeping it up to date?

@sdaftuar maybe. The doc directory isn't the easiest place to do
collaborative editing either, though, and multiple versions of the document
will exist then (on branches/tags) while I've tried to cover a larger range
of versions in one. Maybe the bitcoin-core wiki? (The same we've used for
release note editing for 0.14.0)
